articles.headline: For Romney, a Course Set Long Ago
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney said he felt as if his campaign to become the Republican presidential nominee was, in a sense, an extension of his father’s unsuccessful bid in 1968.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney said he felt as if his campaign to become the Republican presidential nominee was, in a sense, an extension of his father’s unsuccessful bid in 1968.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  George Romney had big ideas for his youngest child.

articles.headline: With Regrets, New Orleans Is Left Behind
articles.snippet: Thousands of former New Orleanians are breaking their ties with the damaged city for which they yearn.
articles.abstract: Thousands of former New Orleanians are breaking their ties with the damaged city for which they yearn.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAKE CHARLES, La.  With resignation, anger or stoicism, thousands of former New Orleanians forced out by Hurricane Katrina are settling in across the Gulf Coast, breaking their ties with the damaged city for which they still yearn.

articles.headline: As Ethanol Takes Its First Steps, Congress Proposes a Giant Leap
articles.snippet: Congress is on the verge of telling American business to create a huge new industry capable of converting agricultural wastes and other plant material into automotive fuel.
articles.abstract: Congress is on the verge of telling American business to create a huge new industry capable of converting agricultural wastes and other plant material into automotive fuel.
articles.lead_paragraph: Congress is on the verge of writing into law one of the most ambitious dictates ever issued to American business: to create, from scratch, a huge new industry capable of converting agricultural wastes and other plant material into automotive fuel.

articles.headline: Amid Strike, 2 NBC Hosts Will Return to the Air
articles.snippet: NBC announced that Jay Leno and Conan O’Brien will return to the air even if writers are still striking.
articles.abstract: NBC announced that Jay Leno and Conan O’Brien will return to the air even if writers are still striking.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC announced on Monday that its two late-night stars, Jay Leno and Conan O’Brien, would return on Jan. 2 even if the strike against networks and studios by writers was not resolved.

articles.headline: Iran Receives Nuclear Fuel in Blow to U.S.
articles.snippet: Russia delivered nuclear fuel for an Iranian power plant that is at the center of the dispute over Iran’s nuclear program.
articles.abstract: Russia delivered nuclear fuel for an Iranian power plant that is at the center of the dispute over Iran’s nuclear program.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The United States lost a long battle when Russia, as it announced on Monday, delivered nuclear fuel to an Iranian power plant that is at the center of an international dispute over its nuclear program. Iran, for its part, confirmed on Monday plans to build a second such plant.

articles.headline: Food and Fuel Compete for Land
articles.snippet: For years, cheap food and feed were taken for granted in the United States. Now the price of some foods is rising sharply, and a blame alert is under way.
articles.abstract: For years, cheap food and feed were taken for granted in the United States. Now the price of some foods is rising sharply, and a blame alert is under way.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shopping at a Whole Foods Market in suburban Chicago, Meredith Estes said food prices have jumped so much she has resorted to coupons. Charles T. Rodgers Jr., an Arkansas cattle rancher, said normal feed rations so expensive and scarce he is scrambling for alternatives. In Oregon, Jack Joyce, the owner of Rogue Ales, said the cost of barley malt has soared 88 percent this year.

articles.headline: Former Russian Spies Are Now Prominent in Business
articles.snippet: For big Western companies, the prevalence of former Federal Security Service agents in Russian business is raising questions of ethics and due diligence.
articles.abstract: For big Western companies, the prevalence of former Federal Security Service agents in Russian business is raising questions of ethics and due diligence.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  At a venture capital conference in Silicon Valley, Oleg S. Shvartsman mixed easily among the titans of private equity.

articles.headline: Fed Shrugged as Subprime Crisis Spread
articles.snippet: As the mortgage crisis threatens to tip the economy into a recession, many are asking: Where was Washington?
articles.abstract: As the mortgage crisis threatens to tip the economy into a recession, many are asking: Where was Washington?
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Until the boom in subprime mortgages turned into a national nightmare this summer, the few people who tried to warn federal banking officials might as well have been talking to themselves.

articles.headline: Songs of Love and Murder, Silenced by Killings
articles.snippet: Mexico’s country music stars are being killed at an alarming rate — 13 in the past year and a half.
articles.abstract: Mexico’s country music stars are being killed at an alarming rate — 13 in the past year and a half.
articles.lead_paragraph: MORELIA, Mexico  Mexico’s country music stars are being killed at an alarming rate  13 in the past year and a half, three already in December  in a trend that has gone hand in hand with the surge in violence between drug gangs here.
